datafield.subfield: Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation.
Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music papers,
Papers of the Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music

@alpha_character^a^@alpha_srt^army^@title^Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music Papers^@href^http://hdl.loc.gov/loc.music/eadmus.mu005002^@aggregate^mu^@ead_file_name^mu005002.xml^@eadid^mu005002^

The collection represents the working papers of the sub-committee: correspondence from members to, among others, Aaron Copland, Leonard Feist, Oscar Hammerstein II, Jerome Kern, Erich Leinsdorf, Alan Lomax, and Walter Toscanini; song book pamphlets ("Army Hit Kits"), sheet music; non-music publications; and administrative papers.

did.abstract: The collection represents the working papers of the sub-committee: correspondence from members to, among others, Aaron Copland, Leonard Feist, Oscar Hammerstein II, Jerome Kern, Erich Leinsdorf, Alan Lomax, and Walter Toscanini; song book pamphlets ("Army Hit Kits"), sheet music; non-music publications; and administrative papers.

note.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the Library's online catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically therein.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-committee on Music Papers were processed in 1994 by Robert Saladini with assistance from Jerry Pietrosewicz. The original finding aid was prepared with Corel WordPerfect 8. In 2005 the Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-committee on Music Papers finding aid was coded for EAD format by Michael A. Ferrando.

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: The status of copyright on the papers of the Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music is governed by the Copyright Law of the United States (Title 17, U.S.C.).

userestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
userestrict.p: The Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music Papers are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Performing Arts Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use. Certain restrictions to use or copying of materials may apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: container number, Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music Papers, Music Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: On September 25, 1941, the Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation announced the appointment of a Sub-committee on Music, formed to advise the Army, Navy and Marine Corps on all matters pertaining to musical activities within military camps and reservations during and after World War II (1941 to 1946). The Sub-committee was also to aid in coordinating plans for musical entertainment of the soldiers in the communities outside the camps and stations. Dr. Harold Spivacke, chief of the Music Division at the Library of Congress from 1937 to 1972, was named as the chairman. This collection consists of the working papers of the Sub-committee.

In addition, the collection contains some related materials that were given to the Library of Congress Music Division on June 24, 1943, by the Industrial Service Division, Bureau of Public Relations, War Department, Washington, D.C. Before the collection was processed these War Department materials, which were designated "for War Collection, Music Division," were interfiled among the Sub-committee's papers.

The bulk of the collection consists of an alphabetically arranged correspondence and subject file. Present are letters from original members of the sub-committee including Fred Birnbach, Secretary of the American Federation of Musicians; C. V. Buttelman, Executive Secretary of the Music Educators National Conference; music publisher, Harry Fox; and Noble Sissle, President of the Negro Actors Guild of America, Inc. In addition, there are copies of letters to such well-known musical personalities of the era as Aaron Copland, Leonard Feist, Oscar Hammerstein 2nd, Jerome Kern, Erich Leinsdorf, Alan Lomax and Walter Toscanani. A sub-series of correspondence addressed to member publishing companies of the Music Publishers' Protective Association, Harry Fox, General Manager, from servicemen requesting complimentary sheet music, is included in the collection. Of special interest are the lists of best selling recordings during the war years and a collection of "Army Hit Kits," pamphlet-size song books that were distributed to servicemen.
Original file folder identification and filing order as maintained by Sub-committee staff has been preserved in the processing of this collection.

Jerry Pietrosewicz, Technician
Robert Saladini, Music Specialist
June 1993

arrangement.head: Organization of the Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music Papers
arrangement.p: The Joint Army and Navy Committee on Welfare and Recreation, Sub-Committee on Music Papers are organized into four series:

scopecontent.p: The Correspondence series is represented by two subseries: General Correspondence ; Music Publishers Protective Association.

scopecontent.p: The Administrative Papers series consists of meeting minutes, memorandas and various lists.

scopecontent.p: The Publications, Non-Music series consists of various non-music publications.

list.item: Army Hit Kits, filed in chronological order by year and thereafter by letter (BOX: 40)

scopecontent.p: The Miscellaneous series consists of assorted items.
